document_data.name: Soapstone
document_data.mainbody: '''Soapstone''', also known as steatite, was a soft and brittle but easily worked [[hardstones|hardstone]].
document_data.Description: This harder version of [[wikipedia:en:Talc|talc]] was found in colors ranging from white to green and was often dyed other colors. Easily worked by unskilled hands for low-detail carving, it could hold intricate patterns but was not hard enough to hold delicate shapes. It could be easily polished to a warm, glossy finish. A typical price was 9 sp per {{SI|1|lb|k|long=yes}}.
document_data.Powers: Colloquial wisdom gave soapstone some mystical properties involving fire or capturing warmth, but these have not yet been proven.
